result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL T WERTH

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

9:26 AM Defendant MICHAEL T WERTH appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Joseph Levin in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Defendant is eligible for SPD. DE requesting additional time for attorney to be appointed. Record closed @ 928
Further proceedings scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
unsigned Bail/Bond form returned from WCJ - DE refused to sign on 10-11-2022

The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 303
